channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: A Two-Stage Method for Chinese AMR Parsing
item.description: In this paper, we provide a detailed description of our system at CAMRP-2022 evaluation.

item.title: Federated Stain Normalization for Computational Pathology
item.description: As a solution, we propose BottleGAN, a generative model that can computationally align the staining styles of many laboratories and can be trained in a privacy-preserving manner to foster federated learning in computational pathology.

item.title: Proportional Multicalibration
item.description: Multicalibration is a desirable fairness criteria that constrains calibration error among flexibly-defined groups in the data while maintaining overall calibration.

item.title: EDA: Explicit Text-Decoupling and Dense Alignment for 3D Visual and Language Learning
item.description: 3D visual grounding aims to find the objects within point clouds mentioned by free-form natural language descriptions with rich semantic components.

item.title: TERMinator: A system for scientific texts processing
item.description: This paper is devoted to the extraction of entities and semantic relations between them from scientific texts, where we consider scientific terms as entities.

item.title: Diffusion Posterior Sampling for General Noisy Inverse Problems
item.description: Diffusion models have been recently studied as powerful generative inverse problem solvers, owing to their high quality reconstructions and the ease of combining existing iterative solvers.

item.title: Human Motion Diffusion Model
item.description: In this paper, we introduce Motion Diffusion Model (MDM), a carefully adapted classifier-free diffusion-based generative model for the human motion domain.

item.title: Facial Landmark Predictions with Applications to Metaverse
item.description: This research aims to make metaverse characters more realistic by adding lip animations learnt from videos in the wild.

item.title: Online pseudo labeling for polyp segmentation with momentum networks
item.description: In this work, we present a new pseudo labeling strategy that enhances the quality of pseudo labels used for training student networks.

item.title: NAG-GS: Semi-Implicit, Accelerated and Robust Stochastic Optimizers
item.description: Classical machine learning models such as deep neural networks are usually trained by using Stochastic Gradient Descent-based (SGD) algorithms.

item.title: 4D-StOP: Panoptic Segmentation of 4D LiDAR using Spatio-temporal Object Proposal Generation and Aggregation
item.description: Our voting-based tracklet generation method followed by geometric feature-based aggregation generates significantly improved panoptic LiDAR segmentation quality when compared to modeling the entire 4D volume using Gaussian probability distributions.

item.title: Perturbations and Subpopulations for Testing Robustness in Token-Based Argument Unit Recognition
item.description: Argument Unit Recognition and Classification aims at identifying argument units from text and classifying them as pro or against.

item.title: Denoising MCMC for Accelerating Diffusion-Based Generative Models
item.description: Diffusion models are powerful generative models that simulate the reverse of diffusion processes using score functions to synthesize data from noise.

item.title: Neural Media Bias Detection Using Distant Supervision With BABE -- Bias Annotations By Experts
item.description: Fine-tuning and evaluating the model on our proposed supervised data set, we achieve a macro F1-score of 0. 804, outperforming existing methods.

item.title: COLO: A Contrastive Learning based Re-ranking Framework for One-Stage Summarization
item.description: Traditional training paradigms for extractive and abstractive summarization systems always only use token-level or sentence-level training objectives.

item.title: polyBERT: A chemical language model to enable fully machine-driven ultrafast polymer informatics
item.description: polyBERT is a chemical linguist that treats the chemical structure of polymers as a chemical language.

item.title: GDIP: Gated Differentiable Image Processing for Object-Detection in Adverse Conditions
item.description: We present a Gated Differentiable Image Processing (GDIP) block, a domain-agnostic network architecture, which can be plugged into existing object detection networks (e. g., Yolo) and trained end-to-end with adverse condition images such as those captured under fog and low lighting.

item.title: A Coarse-to-fine Cascaded Evidence-Distillation Neural Network for Explainable Fake News Detection
item.description: Existing fake news detection methods aim to classify a piece of news as true or false and provide veracity explanations, achieving remarkable performances.

item.title: NAF: Neural Attenuation Fields for Sparse-View CBCT Reconstruction
item.description: This paper proposes a novel and fast self-supervised solution for sparse-view CBCT reconstruction (Cone Beam Computed Tomography) that requires no external training data.

item.title: Chandojnanam: A Sanskrit Meter Identification and Utilization System
item.description: We present Chandoj\~n\=anam, a web-based Sanskrit meter (Chanda) identification and utilization system.

item.title: SymmNeRF: Learning to Explore Symmetry Prior for Single-View View Synthesis
item.description: We study the problem of novel view synthesis of objects from a single image.

item.title: Intrinsic Dimensionality Estimation within Tight Localities: A Theoretical and Experimental Analysis
item.description: Accurate estimation of Intrinsic Dimensionality (ID) is of crucial importance in many data mining and machine learning tasks, including dimensionality reduction, outlier detection, similarity search and subspace clustering.

item.title: DiGress: Discrete Denoising diffusion for graph generation
item.description: This work introduces DiGress, a discrete denoising diffusion model for generating graphs with categorical node and edge attributes.

item.title: R2C-GAN: Restore-to-Classify GANs for Blind X-Ray Restoration and COVID-19 Classification
item.description: The proposed restoration approach achieves over 90% F1-Score which is significantly higher than the performance of any deep model.

item.title: Regularizing Neural Network Training via Identity-wise Discriminative Feature Suppression
item.description: It suppresses features that can be utilized to identify individual instances among samples within each class.

item.title: Evaluating the temporal understanding of neural networks on event-based action recognition with DVS-Gesture-Chain
item.description: A wide range of benchmark datasets is available to allow for the evaluation of such capabilities when using conventional frame-based video sequences.

item.title: Understanding Collapse in Non-Contrastive Learning
item.description: Contrastive methods have led a recent surge in the performance of self-supervised representation learning (SSL).

item.title: Training β-VAE by Aggregating a Learned Gaussian Posterior with a Decoupled Decoder
item.description: The reconstruction loss and the Kullback-Leibler divergence (KLD) loss in a variational autoencoder (VAE) often play antagonistic roles, and tuning the weight of the KLD loss in $\beta$-VAE to achieve a balance between the two losses is a tricky and dataset-specific task.

item.title: An Equal-Size Hard EM Algorithm for Diverse Dialogue Generation
item.description: Open-domain dialogue systems aim to interact with humans through natural language texts in an open-ended fashion.

item.title: Patients' Severity States Classification based on Electronic Health Record (EHR) Data using Multiple Machine Learning and Deep Learning Approaches
item.description: For implementing Deep Learning we employed a feed-forward neural network (multi-layer) and the Fast Large Margin approach for semi-supervised learning.

item.title: Is Complexity Required for Neural Network Pruning? A Case Study on Global Magnitude Pruning
item.description: Surprisingly, we find that vanilla Global MP outperforms all the other SOTA techniques and achieves a new SOTA result.

item.title: Compressed Gastric Image Generation Based on Soft-Label Dataset Distillation for Medical Data Sharing
item.description: Furthermore, our method can extract essential weights of DCNN models to reduce the memory required to save trained models for efficient medical data sharing.

item.title: Teaching Where to Look: Attention Similarity Knowledge Distillation for Low Resolution Face Recognition
item.description: Deep learning has achieved outstanding performance for face recognition benchmarks, but performance reduces significantly for low resolution (LR) images.

item.title: Dilated Neighborhood Attention Transformer
item.description: These models typically employ localized attention mechanisms, such as the sliding-window Neighborhood Attention (NA) or Swin Transformer's Shifted Window Self Attention.

item.title: Optimistic Posterior Sampling for Reinforcement Learning with Few Samples and Tight Guarantees
item.description: We consider reinforcement learning in an environment modeled by an episodic, finite, stage-dependent Markov decision process of horizon $H$ with $S$ states, and $A$ actions.

item.title: Strong Instance Segmentation Pipeline for MMSports Challenge
item.description: The goal of ACM MMSports2022 DeepSportRadar Instance Segmentation Challenge is to tackle the segmentation of individual humans including players, coaches and referees on a basketball court.

item.title: Scalably learning quantum many-body Hamiltonians from dynamical data
item.description: The physics of a closed quantum mechanical system is governed by its Hamiltonian.

item.title: Assessing Coarse-to-Fine Deep Learning Models for Optic Disc and Cup Segmentation in Fundus Images
item.description: In this paper we present a comprehensive analysis of different coarse-to-fine designs for OD/OC segmentation using 5 public databases, both from a standard segmentation perspective and for estimating the vCDR for glaucoma assessment.

item.title: UNesT: Local Spatial Representation Learning with Hierarchical Transformer for Efficient Medical Segmentation
item.description: Transformer-based models, capable of learning better global dependencies, have recently demonstrated exceptional representation learning capabilities in computer vision and medical image analysis.

item.title: InFi: End-to-End Learning to Filter Input for Resource-Efficiency in Mobile-Centric Inference
item.description: Previous efforts have tailored effective solutions for many applications, but left two essential questions unanswered: (1) theoretical filterability of an inference workload to guide the application of input filtering techniques, thereby avoiding the trial-and-error cost for resource-constrained mobile applications; (2) robust discriminability of feature embedding to allow input filtering to be widely effective for diverse inference tasks and input content.

item.title: LL-GNN: Low Latency Graph Neural Networks on FPGAs for Particle Detectors
item.description: In addition, we introduce an outer-product based matrix multiplication approach which is enhanced by the strength reduction for low latency design.

item.title: MTU-Net: Multi-level TransUNet for Space-based Infrared Tiny Ship Detection
item.description: Due to the extremely large image coverage area (e. g., thousands square kilometers), candidate targets in these images are much smaller, dimer, more changeable than those targets observed by aerial-based and land-based imaging devices.

item.title: Guiding Safe Exploration with Weakest Preconditions
item.description: In reinforcement learning for safety-critical settings, it is often desirable for the agent to obey safety constraints at all points in time, including during training.

item.title: Obj2Seq: Formatting Objects as Sequences with Class Prompt for Visual Tasks
item.description: Obj2Seq is able to flexibly determine input categories to satisfy customized requirements, and be easily extended to different visual tasks.

item.title: Efficient block contrastive learning via parameter-free meta-node approximation
item.description: In this work, we propose a meta-node based approximation technique that can (a) proxy all negative combinations (b) in quadratic cluster size time complexity, (c) at graph level, not node level, and (d) exploit graph sparsity.

item.title: Experimental study of time series forecasting methods for groundwater level prediction
item.description: Each time series is made of daily measurements of groundwater levels and two exogenous variables, rainfall and evapotranspiration.

item.title: DPNet: Dual-Path Network for Real-time Object Detection with Lightweight Attention
item.description: The recent advances of compressing high-accuracy convolution neural networks (CNNs) have witnessed remarkable progress for real-time object detection.

item.title: Who is GPT-3? An Exploration of Personality, Values and Demographics
item.description: Our results show that GPT-3 scores similarly to human samples in terms of personality and - when provided with a model response memory - in terms of the values it holds.

item.title: Image Compressed Sensing with Multi-scale Dilated Convolutional Neural Network
item.description: During the measurement period, we directly obtain all measurements from a trained measurement network, which employs fully convolutional structures and is jointly trained with the reconstruction network from the input image.

item.title: Denoising of 3D MR images using a voxel-wise hybrid residual MLP-CNN model to improve small lesion diagnostic confidence
item.description: We evaluate the proposed method on 720 T2-FLAIR brain images with small lesions at different noise levels.
